title: Laptop + Monitor Issue
body:
TLDR: I need to know how to set the game resolution to 1080p on a laptop.

I recently got a nice monitor that is at the resolution of 1920 by 1080p I was excited to hook my mac up to it to play League of Legends but it only showed to bottom right corner of the screen. I resolved this issue by taking the game off of fullscreen mode but found another issue in the process. Now weather I go borderless or windowed the game appears as a fairly small window in the center of my desktop. I think this happens because of the 1200 x 800 resolution of my laptop is lower than the 1920 x 1080 of my monitor. I went into the settings menu to look for the proper resolution but all I got were laptop resolutions. Does anyone know how to change the resolution to 1080p on a laptop, or has any other fix ideas I could use?

replies.body:
If you're using your monitor to play the game then the laptop's screen shouldn't really impact it too much.  You could have some bad settings that's not setting your resolution properly, though.  Try [resetting your config](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761934-Mouse-and-Keyboard-Issues#mq2) to reset your resolution to default, then re-adjust it afterwards.  

By the way, as a heads up keep in mind that if your monitor is a 4K (or retina) which isn't currently supported, then you can run into some trouble like this.  You can always swap monitors or disconnect it to rule out hardware possibilities.  Let me know how that works out for you!
